publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-327 Christine Grahame: The Saltire for Scotland’s Capital—That the Parliament welcomes the comments by the Minister for Europe, External Affairs and Culture that the Scottish Government should have responsibility for all guidance related to the flying of national flags in Scotland; notes that Edinburgh Castle, one of Scotland’s premier tourist attractions, continues to fly the Union Flag in a superior position despite the castle being owned and operated by Historic Scotland, an agency of the Scottish Government; notes the existing guidance to all Scottish non-departmental public bodies and agencies that the Saltire should fly prominently from all public buildings, and urges Historic Scotland to ensure that the Saltire, the oldest national flag in Europe, is restored to its rightful place on the principal flagstaff on Edinburgh Castle.

S3M-327 Christine Grahame: The Saltire for Scotland’s Capital—That the Parliament welcomes the comments by the Minister for Europe, External Affairs and Culture that the Scottish Government should have responsibility for all guidance related to the flying of national flags in Scotland; notes that Edinburgh Castle, one of Scotland’s premier tourist attractions, continues to fly the Union Flag in a superior position despite the castle being owned *by Scottish Ministers* and operated by Historic Scotland, an agency of the Scottish Government; notes the existing guidance to all Scottish non-departmental public bodies and agencies that the Saltire should fly prominently from all public buildings, and urges Historic Scotland to ensure that the Saltire, the oldest national flag in Europe, is restored to its rightful place on the principal flagstaff on Edinburgh Castle. Supported by: Bill Kidd*, Alasdair Allan*, Angela Constance*, Bashir Ahmad*, Rob Gibson*, Alex Neil*, Nigel Don*, Sandra White*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Jamie Hepburn*, Keith Brown*, Bob Doris*
